revised_title: Effects of Galvanic Current on Human Motor Nerve Excitability
tldr: This study investigates the impact of galvanic currents on the excitability of human motor nerves. The researchers found that the excitatory effect of an induced current increases during the passage of a galvanic current in the same direction and decreases when the currents flow in opposite directions. These findings provide a better understanding of nerve function and the potential effects of electrical currents on the human body.
